skill.name: openapi-spec-generation
skill.description: Generate and maintain OpenAPI 3.1 specifications from code, design-first specs, and validation patterns. Use when creating API documentation, generating SDKs, or ensuring API contract compliance.
skill.summary: Generate and maintain OpenAPI 3.1 specifications from code, design-first specs, and validation patte...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. Content is instructional templates and best practices without runtime actions.

content.value_statement: Writing OpenAPI specs by hand is slow and inconsistent. This skill provides ready templates, patterns, and validation steps for reliable API contracts.
actual_capabilities: Provide full OpenAPI 3.1 template with paths, schemas, and security
Show design-first, code-first, and hybrid approaches
Include FastAPI and TypeScript examples for spec generation
Detail validation and linting workflows with Spectral and Redocly
Outline SDK generation commands for common languages
limitations: Does not run generators or validators
Requires you to supply your API details and constraints
Does not verify live API behavior against the spec
Does not manage hosting for documentation portals

use_cases.title: Design-first contracts
use_cases.description: Draft a complete OpenAPI 3.1 spec before implementation begins.

use_cases.title: Code-first documentation
use_cases.description: Map existing endpoints to an accurate OpenAPI specification.

use_cases.title: SDK readiness
use_cases.description: Prepare specs that are clean for client generation and linting.

prompt_templates.title: Quick spec outline
prompt_templates.scenario: New REST API with basic CRUD
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an OpenAPI 3.1 outline for a tasks API with list, create, update, delete, and auth header.

prompt_templates.title: Complete spec draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a full OpenAPI 3.1 spec for user management with pagination, errors, and JWT security.

prompt_templates.title: Code-first mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Translate these FastAPI endpoints into OpenAPI paths, schemas, and responses.

prompt_templates.title: Validation plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide Spectral and Redocly rules and commands to validate this OpenAPI spec.

output_examples.input: Create a spec for a products API with search and pagination.
output: Defines endpoints for list, get, create, update, delete
Includes pagination parameters and response schema
Adds standard error responses and security scheme

best_practices: Use reusable components with $ref to reduce duplication
Add realistic examples for requests and responses
Document security and error responses on every operation
anti_patterns: Omitting authentication requirements from protected endpoints
Using vague or missing descriptions for operations
Mixing naming conventions across schemas and paths

faq.question: Is this compatible with OpenAPI 3.1 tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses OpenAPI 3.1 structure and common tooling patterns.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates but does not execute tools or generate files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use the provided linting steps in your CI workflow.

faq.question: Does it access my data or environment?
faq.answer: No, it only produces text guidance based on your prompts.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Check required fields, security definitions, and response schemas for completeness.

faq.question: How does this compare to code-first tools?
faq.answer: It complements code-first tools by shaping consistent contracts and examples.
